intro: Conchocarpus ucayalinus, commonly known as the Andean sycamore, is a tree native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces woody, spherical fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in humid, high-altitude environments and is often found in montane rainforests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
